Comment: I watched The Sound of Music because Reagan mentioned it was his favorite movie. The last time I saw it was over ten years ago. It's a classic film, full of fun and with a great love story. I admire how Maria is kind and stays true to herself, bringing energy and passion to everything she does. Her strong faith helps her face the challenges of the mischievous children and the strict, cold demeanor of the captain without fear.

A friend recommended Reagan to me, and it was a great experience. I didn't realize he was an actor before becoming President of the U.S. This movie taught me a lot about the country and its history. I also really enjoyed seeing the relationship between Reagan and Nancy—their love and support for each other is truly inspiring and amazing!

Distributed by: Warner Bros., Warner Bros. Pictures, Mister Smith Entertainment
Comment: This is the story of the great Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan. Mathematics was his true calling, and he pursued it with unparalleled dedication. His experiences suggest the presence of a higher power and the possiblity of a profound connection with it. It's tragic that Ramanujan's life was cut short so early. His life also reminds us that even those who love us can sometimes unintentionally cause harm, so it's essential to prioritize our own well-being and self-care.

This is a timeless masterpiece. Twelve years ago, I first encountered the story through the movie Les Misérables (2012) and fell in love with it immediately. Today, I watched the musical version, and it was terrific. It touched my heart and soul. My words cannot express my gratitude to all the passionate and dedicated people who made this story and show accessible to me.

Even without extensive knowledge of the Marvel Universe, I found it to be a fun movie. Despite the numerous violent fight scenes, they were neither scary nor sad. After working for a movie company for 2.5 years and visiting three movie studios in Hollywood, I learned to take movie stories less seriously because I know they are fictional. The filmmakers just want us to enjoy ourselves!

Movie Name: South Park: The End of Obesity
Comment: I deeply empathize with those struggling with obesity. It's important to understand that willpower alone often cannot overcome the complex chemical reactions in the body.

Often, people are bound and controlled by their fears. If they can free themselves from these fears, they will discover a new world full of possibilities and attain inner peace. I missed the first 30 minutes of the most famous chariot race, so I need to watch it again.

This is a super fun movie. It reminded me of the great times I had at Super Nintendo World. I should have watched it before visiting Super Nintendo World at Universal Studios. But it's okay. I will visit it again and have more fun next time!
This is a great story. It teaches us to awalys stay kind and have hope. I can't wait to see the second part next week.

This movie is truly inspiring. It shows how when you have a dream and pursue it with passion and diligence, the world supports you. I saw the power of kind words from a teacher and the profound, silent love between a father and his son.
Watching it for the second time with friends on our big new TV! I love the way Robert solves problems.
I watched a horror movie, but I wasn't scared—it was surprisingly warm and cute. This was also my first movie experience on the Paramount Lot.
This is a great story. It moved me deeply, bringing tears to my eyes multiple times as I watched. I should write a blog post for it.

Movie Name: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
Comment: We learn and grow by facing difficult challenges. It's nice to experience this growth in another world without it costing any time in our reality.
I saw the power of faith and the importance of a good leader.

A great story from the Bible about Moses. I love how he accepts who he is and follows his heart, giving up all the wealth, power, and privileges. After making this decision, his life moves on, and he settles with what he has.
A story of a successful failure. I was amazed by how they managed to stay calm and complete their work under immense stress and uncertainty. This ability is crucial for achieving success in life!

A heartwarming and healing movie for kids and families. Each child grows up with an imaginary friend (IF) born from their dreams and imagination. An IF can take any form and possess any skills the child desires. They can see and accompany each other. However, as children grow up, they often become busy with life and lose connection with their IF. This movie tells the story of an 11-year-old girl who helps IFs reconnect with their grown-up owners by rekindling cherished childhood memories.

Distributed by: Allied Stars, Enigma Productions, Warner Bros., The Ladd Company, Warner Brothers
Comment: This is a great story about passion, faith, and commitment! Abraham was able to win the gold medal in Olympics in the end after trying very hard and the training day and night to achieve his goal and realize his stream. He succeeded and became the winner. However, this is just a story about the winner. What about other runners who didn't win the game? My friend provided a good point. This is just the story about this guy. Other people had their own life stories, and they won in their ways.

The jokes in the movie do not make much sense to me. I decided to watched it because of Seinfeld but was kinda disappointed. It was a relaxing comedy movie. You barely need to use your brain to watch it.

Distributed by: Sony Pictures Classics, Warner Bros. Pictures, United International Pictures, Memento Films
Comment: This is a quiet and romantic movie. My favorite lines are: "We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster that we go bankrupt by the age of 30 and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to make yourself feel nothing so as not to feel anything. What a waste!"
I love this movie, the story, and the music. It's a simple and warm story about self-growth and passion. The background in New York City reminds me of the good times I spent there last summer.

Movie Name: In the Land of Saints and Sinners

Comment: Powerful story, impressive pictures, and superb acting. Watching on IMAX it for the second time.

Distributed by: Searchlight Pictures, Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures
Summit Entertainment, Lionsgate Films, Nordisk Film Distribution

Movie Name: The Phantom of the Opera at the Royal Albert Hall

Distributed by: Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon Movies, Elevation Pictures

Movie Name: Creation of the Gods I: Kingdom of Storms
Distributed by: Beijing Jingxi Culture & Tourism, Huaxia Film Distribution, Well Go USA Entertainment (North America)
Warner Bros., Warner Bros. Pictures, Warner Bros. Denmark

Movie Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Mutant Mayhem
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock
Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One
